Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
ICON MANCHESTER AIRPORT IS AN EXCITING WAREHOUSE/LOGISTICS DEVELOPMENT WITH DETAILED PLANNING CONSENT CAPABLE OF DELIVERING BUILD TO SUIT UNITS UP TO 459,000 SQ FT WITHIN 12 MONTHS. ICON MANCHESTER AIRPORT OFFERS EXCEPTIONAL TRANSPORT
AND BUSINESS CONNECTIVITY WITHIN THIS RAPIDLY GROWING GLOBAL LOGISTICS AREA OF AIRPORT CITY. ICON MANCHESTER AIRPORT IS LOCATED IMMEDIATELY WEST OF MANCHESTER AIRPORT, IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO THE WORLD FREIGHT TERMINAL, WITH AIRSIDE OPERATIONS WITHIN 0.5 MILE. METROLINK TRAMS FROM MANCHESTER AIRPORT TO MANCHESTER CITY CENTRE PROVIDE EXCELLENT PUBLIC TRANSPORT LINKS.
ICON MANCHESTER AIRPORT IS ONE OF THE NORTH WEST’S KEY LOGISTICS/ WAREHOUSE LOCATIONS WITH THE MOTORWAY AND NATIONAL RAIL NETWORK OFFERING DIRECT ACCESS TO LOCAL AND REGIONAL MARKETS.

Ringway Trading Estate extends to 13,939 sq m (150,039 sq ft) offering B1 B2 and B8 accommodation. The estate sits within an attractive landscaped environment and boasts excellent transports links, with Manchester Airport situated less than 1 mile away and Jct 5 of the M56 motorway within proximity.

Ringway Trading Estate extends to 13,939 sq m (150,039 sq ft) offering B1 B2 and B8 accommodation. The estate sits within an attractive landscaped environment and boasts excellent transports links, with Manchester Airport situated less than 1 mile away and Jct 5 of the M56 motorway within proximity.

Southmoor Park provides a range of modern industrial/warehouse units, which were developed in the early 1990’s. Southmoor Park is located at the end of Greeba Road, within the popular Roundthorn Industrial Estate. Roundthorn is one of South Manchester’s most established industrial / commercial areas with excellent links to the M56 and M60 motorways. The estate is an established service centre for Manchester Airport, which lies approximately three miles to the South East and provides easy access into Manchester City Centre via the A5103 (Princess Parkway).

Southmoor Park provides a range of modern industrial/warehouse units, which were developed in the early 1990’s. Southmoor Park is located at the end of Greeba Road, within the popular Roundthorn Industrial Estate. Roundthorn is one of South Manchester’s most established industrial / commercial areas with excellent links to the M56 and M60 motorways. The estate is an established service centre for Manchester Airport, which lies approximately three miles to the South East and provides easy access into Manchester City Centre via the A5103 (Princess Parkway).

Stockport Trading Estate is in an excellent location off Yew Street offering immediate access to Junction 1 of the M60 and in turn the regions motorway network. Local occupiers include Williams BMW and Booker Cash & Carry amongst others. Stockport town centre is within 1 mile and Manchester city centre is approximately 5 miles to the north.

Situated adjacent to Tesco Extra off junction 27 of the M60 within a stones throw of Stockport, 7 miles from Manchester city centre to the north and 8 miles from Manchester International Airport to the south.

The property is located on Mosley Road, north of the junction with Village Way (A5081) Trafford Park, Manchester. Trafford Park is located approximately 3 miles (5 km) to the west of Manchester City Centre. It has excellent access to Manchester motorway network, junction 2 of the M602 is approximately 1 mile (1.25 km) to the north. Junctions 9, 10 and 11 of the M60 Manchester Orbital Motorway are within approximately 1.85 miles (3 km). The M60 provides access to the M56 and Manchester International Airport with is approximately 10 miles (16 km) away. The property is located within close proximity of two Metrolink tram stops offering excellent transport links across Greater Manchester. Parkway stop is located 800m south west and Village stop is located 900m to the south east.



Comprises a speculative new build warehouse / industrial unit on a site area of 2.305 acres (0.933 ha).

Common.Photos.Common.ImageCaption: TRAFFORD PARK THE WORKS WAREHOUSE INTERNAL

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
ARK comprises a modern distribution facility located in the heart of Trafford Park and within 4.5 miles of Manchester City Centre. The principal high bay warehouse was built in 1992 and comprises a detached unit plus ancillary offices on a self contained secure site, with access from Trafford Park Road and Trafford Wharf Road. Trafford Park is one of the UK’s largest industrial areas extending to over 1,200 acres and home to over 1,400 businesses including notable high profile occupiers such as Kellogg’s, Amazon, L’Oreal and Adidas. Media City, Manchester United and the Trafford Centre with
associated amenities are all located within close proximity.

The property is situated on Tenax Road (A576) in a prominent location within the heart of Trafford Park. Trafford Park is home to over 1,300 companies and is the premier industrial area in the North West of England with excellent motorway connections. Manchester City Centre is approximately 4 miles to the north east and access to the motorway network is via junctions 9 and 10 of the M60 and junction 2 of the M602. The property comprises a terraced industrial unit of brick construction with profile metal clad elevations beneath pitched/northern lit roof sections. There is a shared yard/loading area to the front of the unit.

Guinness Point offers a prominent high quality new build development within the heart of one of the North West’s prime industrial/logistics locations. The 3.4 acre site is available on a design and build basis with outline planning permission in place to provide a detached self-contained unit. Guinness Point is a secure site with prominent frontage onto 3 separate roads within the heart of Trafford Park. The central position provides excellentaccess to the motorway, J9 M60 1.9 miles away and the city centre being 4.5 miles away. Trafford Park is home to more than 1,400 businesses and is Europe’s biggest industrial estate. It covers approximately 1,200 acres and represents one of the largest concentrations of industrial and warehousing space in the UK.

GUINNESS POINT is a secure site with prominent frontage onto 3 separate roads within the heart of Trafford Park. The central position provides excellent access to the motorway, J9 M60 1.5 miles away and the city centre being 5 miles away. TRAFFORD PARK is home to more than 1,400 businesses and is Europe’s biggest industrial estate. It covers approximately 1,200 acres and represents one of the largest concentrations of industrial and warehousing space in the UK.

The estate is situated on Harp Road off Guinness Road, in the heart of Trafford Park and within 1.5 miles of junctions 9&10 of the M60 orbital motorway, which can be accessed via Parkway (A5081) and Ashburton Road West (B5214). Junction 2 of the M602 is within 1.5 miles of the estate
and can be accessed via Centenary Way which is at the Eastern end of Guinness Road. Manchester city centre lies approximately 4 miles to the East of the estate and Manchester airport, 10 miles to the South.

The premises comprise a modern detached, high specification industrial/warehouse unit extending to approximately 22,271 sq. ft. The subject property forms part of Centenary Park Estate which occupies a prominent position fronting Coronet Way, Salford. The estate is strategically located 3 miles west of Manchester City Centre, within a mile of Media City and sits immediately adjacent to the Centenary Bridge at the Northern Gateway to Trafford Park connecting Salford and Trafford Park. Junction 2 of the M602 is located approximately 0.25 miles from the property and provides excellent connectivity to the M60, M62, M61, M6 motorways. Trafford Park represents one of the largest concentration of industrial and warehousing space in the UK, home to more than 1,400 businesses and covering approximately 1,200 acres. Key occupiers include Kellogg’s, Amazon, L’Oreal and Adidas. Media City is home to key occupiers including BBC, ITV and The University of Salford.

Common.Highlight.Common.Text: Full Height Electric Level Loading Doors

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: Satellite Park phase 2 represents the largest, most high profile speculative industrial development in East Manchester within the last 10 years. Located within an established industrial area Ideally situated within 1 mile of Junction 21 to the M60 motorway. Offering design and build opportunities from 20,000 to 95,000 sq ft.
367,163 sq ft - speculative development - onsite July 2021 - available Q2 2022.

Developed in 1998 and extended in 2002, the well specified distribution facility comprises 346,526 sq ft plus additional offices situated on a secure site. The unit benefits from 360 degree circulation, two separate yards and secure car parking. Home to numerous household names including Shop Direct, Heinz & White Arrow, Martland Park is an excellent strategic location within easy reach of junctions 25 and 26 of the M6 and within minutes of Wigan town centre via the A49. Major motorway and road networks including the M6, M61, M60, M62, M56 and A580 are within easy reach. Wigan is situated on the West Coast main rail line providing regular services to London, Manchester and Liverpool.

H2 Located within the established Heywood Ditribution park. Heywood Distribution Park is one of the best known industrial and distribution estates in the North West. The estate benefits from award winning 24/7 security and is set within an attractive, landscaped environment. The Park’s award-winning Truck Stop and Café offers truckers superb facilities and secure overnight parking. H2 is a new 148, 856 sq ft industrial/logistics unit built to a high specification within an established distribution park. Heywood is located just one mile east of Junction 3 of the M66 and within three miles of Junctions 18 and 19 of the M62. This prime location allows rapid, easy access to the entire North West region and the Trans Pennine motorway network. It puts every major population centre from London to Edinburgh within a four hour drive and 20 million people within two hours. Conveniently close to the M60 orbital motorway, Heywood Point is just nine miles from Manchester city centre.

A new development offering Design & Build opportunities for both manufacturing and distribution businesses. H-Park is situated 2 miles from junction 19 of the M62 with a new purpose built link road. Only 2 miles from junction 3 of the M66 and the intersection of M60/M62/M66 is within 3 miles. This prime location allows rapid, easy access to the entire Conveniently close to the M60 orbital motorway, North West region and the Trans Pennine motorway network.

M1 Heywood provides a high bay industrial/warehouse unit constructed of steel portal frame, benefiting from both drive in and dock level access. The unit was refurbished in 2013 and is fully sprinklered and has the ability to extend the existing external yard up to 1.35 acres. Heywood is located just one mile east of junction 3 of the M66 and within three miles of Junction 18 and 19 of the M62.
